item.title: [TUT]Fixing a few map problems[Tut]
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

NONE OF THIS CODE IS MADE MY ME. All credit goes to the nice folks from roon-servah…Since no one would…Or could…Help me here. I figured I’de post some of this here to help people out…Once again…NONE OF THIS CODE IS MINE. I TAKE NO CREDIT WHATSOEVER.

  1. BACK UP YOUR FILES

Classes changed: client, Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1
Purpose: To fix the square map and white/black minimap problems
Difficulty: Uh…1/10? If not 0…Just gotta know how to copy and paste…

Alrighty, so…Here’s the errors we will be fixing!

Example 1, the black/white minimap:

Example 2, the square minimap:

Let’s fix the white/black minimap first.

Okay, first off. If you have a mapback sprite with a black minimap/compass area…Make those black areas white. (Not. This is just a cheap fix. It WILL make all sprites with white in them become transparent…)

Next, open up Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 and search for this:

public void method349

Then, replace that entire method with this:

[code] public void method349(int ai[], int ai1[], int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1,
int j1, int k1)
{
int l1 = -(l >> 2);
l = -(l & 3);
for(int i2 = -i1; i2 < 0; i2++)
{
for(int j2 = l1; j2 < 0; j2++)
{
i = ai1[j++];
if(i == -0xfefeff)
{
ai[k] = -ai[k++];
} else
if(i != 0 && i != -1)
{
ai[k++] = i;
} else
{
k++;
}
i = ai1[j++];
if(i == -0xfefeff)
{
ai[k] = -ai[k++];
} else
if(i != 0 && i != -1)
{
ai[k++] = i;
} else
{
k++;
}
i = ai1[j++];
if(i == -0xfefeff)
{
ai[k] = -ai[k++];
} else
if(i != 0 && i != -1)
{
ai[k++] = i;
} else
{
k++;
}
i = ai1[j++];
if(i == -0xfefeff)
{
ai[k] = -ai[k++];
} else
if(i != 0 && i != -1)
{
ai[k++] = i;
} else
{
k++;
}
}

        for(int k2 = l; k2 < 0; k2++)
        {
            i = ai1[j++];
            if(i == -0xfefeff)
            {
                ai[k] = -ai[k++];
            } else
            if(i != 0 && i != -1)
            {
                ai[k++] = i;
            } else
            {
                k++;
            }
        }

        k += j1;
        j += k1;
    }

}[/code]

NOTE: As stated above, that will make ALL the white area in ANY of your sprites become transparent. So…Have fun with that.

Okay, so let’s fix the square map next!

Open up your client class and search for:

Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method336(3, 78, 97, 0xffffff, 3, 0);

Below that, add this:

CustomMapback.method348(0, 16083, 0); //final fix

End result:

That should fix those problems! If you have any errors or anything I’ll try to help…But, like I said. I didn’t make these, sooo…Anyways…

Credits:
bluurr - Square map fix
Yarnova - Transparent sprites
Kuchiki - Hardly any…For…Posting these here so people can fix these problems.

Read full topic
